This paper deals with the problem of optimal power allocation over communication channels, which is a classic problem in information theory (cs.IT). The problem is modeled as a partially observable Markov decision process (POMDP), which is a common framework in control theory and robotics (cs.SY). The authors also use linear programming simulation to verify their analytical results, which falls under the category of mathematical optimization (cs.MA). The problem of power allocation can also be viewed as a game between the transmitter and the channels, which relates to game theory (cs.GT). Finally, the authors discuss the construction of the optimal policy, which involves threshold calculation and linear programming simulation, which falls under the category of machine learning (cs.LG).
